line.en: It was probably because we're young.
Even now, I'm surprised at myself for having sex\nin a place like this.
'...There's a smell.'
'Guess we'll have to let in some air, huh?'
I didn't notice during, but once we finished, I\nnoticed that the smell of sweat had permeated the\nroom.
It wasn't a bad smell, but it probably wasn't\nanything good for people other than us.
Fortunately, club activities were suspended, but\ndepending on the situation, it's possible they\nmight start again tomorrow.
Like before, Asa-chan was still sleeping.
'Even though we were so loud... she must've been\nvery tired.'
'Yeah. A lot of things happened, after all...'
'...By the way, senpai. Is your arm okay? You\nwere really rough with it...'
'Yeah, I'll be fine if it's only that much.'
'You shouldn't push yourself, you know? It'd be\nsuper idiotic if you made it worse because of\nsex...'
'I-I guess so...'
Making my body get worse from sex.. Even being an\nidiot has its limits.
I don't know if you can call it being rough, but\nuntil I make a full recovery, it's necessary to\nrest to some extent.
'I see. And that reminds me, we have to do\nsomething about a pilot.'
'Huh?'

'The doctor said it's off limits for me. Flying,
that is. ...We were really slow to respond to
this situation, so we need to do something about
it right away.'
It's really too bad, but even if I luck out and\nmake a quick recovery, it would be too dangerous\nfor me to try to fly like this.

...I thought of just sucking it up and trying to
fly anyway, but I thought there was always a
slight chance that it might end up being a
problem for the others.
It was like when I was little and I hurt myself\non my bike. It worried my mother to no end.
'I'm not telling you to stop what you're doing,\nbut you need to rest a while until you're all\nbetter.'
'Because with how you are now, I don't want to\nsee you going beyond the point of no return.'
After yesterday's phone call, since I'd made her\nthat promise, I couldn't break it.
So, it had to be someone other than me. Someone\nelse would just have to fly.
'...Okay, enough already. Whatever you say. I\nguess that's just the situation.'
'Oh?'
'If that's how it is, it's okay. There's a\nreplacement.'
'Is there?'
'Yes. Incidentally, this person also has a\nlicense.'
'Yeah, but... for non-members it's a little\ndifferent...'
'But, she's a member.'
'Huh?'
Who? Nobody other than me has a license...
'Me.'
'...What?'
'I have a license.'
'Is it really going to be possible to repair the\nglider? In this short amount of time!?'
'That's awesome! Alright, Aoi!'
We heard from the chairman that the repairs\nseemed possible, so now we were sharing the news\nwith everyone.
Ageha and Amane came to check up on me at the\ndorm, just like yesterday.
'Yeah. Well, it wasn't me. We have Asa and Yoru\nto thank for this.'
'Well, more than us it was really...'
'We really have our grandfather to thank for\nthis.'
'I don't know, the director is providing funds\nand arranging the repairs. It just seems like\nsome kind of underhanded trick.'
'Is it really okay to depend on him for this?'
'Well, what about us, then...? Do you think we're\nokay? I mean, being so meddlesome like that and\nall...'
'Some of the procedures will just have to be\ntaken on good faith.'
'Hmmm... I'm not really worried about it. What\ndoes Aoi think?'
'I didn't think it was any problem, so we got his\nhelp.'
'It's true that we'll be getting help from\nsomeone other than ourselves, but I think that's\njust part of having a club.'
I mean, our meeting place was provided for us,\nand we always rely on An-chan to get materials\nfor us.
To think that we can accomplish everything on our\nown is just naive.
'More than anything, I just think that if we have\na chance... we should take it.'
'Yeah, I think so too.'
'But, what are we gonna do about the pilot? Is\nAoi just going to ignore the doctor and fly\nanyway?'
'Well, I could do that, but...'
'I'm going to handle it.'
'You? You're going to be the pilot...?'
'I'll be fine. Because I got my license.'
'Seriously!? Since when!?'
'...Last year, she asked Grandpa and he let her\ntrain secretly.'
'I didn't even know myself... Hmph.'
'There was no real reason to talk about it.'
'No reason to talk about it...? But you should've\ntold me when we came to the dorm...'
'She probably just trained because she thought\nthat you seemed interested in it.'
'Like, maybe when Asa started to want to study\nherself, she should have told her?'
'...Was it wrong?'
'I see... she really thinks like a big sister,\nhuh?'
Yoru's cheeks began to flush and she fidgeted\nuncomfortably.
Yoru was really deeply concerned about what Asa\nthought.
But if she got her license secretly... wouldn't\nshe end up having to get some odd jobs really\nquickly?
She used her family's influence and probably\nborrowed money when she was training... Yoru just\nexcelled at anything she tried.
'Well, it's not something I can just decide on my\nown. I mean, if it's okay with all you guys?'
'I don't have any reason to object. What about\nyou, Ageha?'
'It's fine with me, too. And I guess it's fine\nwith Aoi?'
'Of course.'
'Is it okay with our advisor?'
'I think it should be fine.'
'Also, this way is better to remedy any weight\nproblems that might come up from using the cloth.\nSince Yoru's pretty light.'
I realized they were talking about me.
Yeah, I guess so. There's a pretty big weight\ndifference if I'm the pilot versus Yoru.
Maybe...
'So, I guess that means we've decided on Yoru.'
'Do your best, Yoru.'
'That goes without saying.'
'The very first time we came here, I never\nwould've dreamed things would turn out like\nthis.'
Me neither. At the beginning, I thought that you\ndidn't really care one way or the other about the\nclub.
And yet, now you've gotten so involved with it,\nby your own choice.
'So, who's going to be the co-pilot? We should go\nahead and decide on that, too...'
'Aoi should be able to manage alright as the\nco-pilot, right?'
'I still have some injuries, and they told me not\nto fly. If we don't need a pilot, I think I\nshould pass...'
'I would be useless as co-pilot.'
'Hmm... I think Asa would be better for that than\nme.'
'Seriously!? Me?'
Surprisingly enough, Kotori just gave up the seat\nto Asa.
'She's already practiced so many times in the\nsimulator, right?'
'And she's really in tune with her sister. After\nall, they were the ones who gave us this chance\nin the first place, right?'
'Is this okay with you, Kotori?'
'Huh? Is what okay?'
'I mean, you wanted to fly, didn't you, if you\nhad it your way?'
'If it's good for everybody else, then it's fine\nwith me.'
She was right.
'...What do you think, Aoi?'
'He probably doesn't have any objections to this,\neither. Asa is the lightest one among us, right?'
That's right.
And since the glider's performance has changed\nnow, that probably means that this would be the\nmost appropriate arrangement.
'I think if it's possible, she would be best.'
'Yoru?'
'Anyhow, in this kind of situation, I think you\nwould be best. I want to try to do this\ntogether.'
For a while, Asa just sat silently thinking with\na meek expression on her face.
I realized that Asa was looking in my direction.
She was seeking my opinion.
'I think Asa is good for the job, too. It's\nreally fitting if Yoru is going to be flying.'
Also, I thought that Asa really wanted to fly.
Maybe it was because it was my lover's self-worth\nat stake, or maybe some other reason. I don't\nreally know why.
I just felt like Asa was ready to aim for the\nsky.
'Yeah. Alright.'
'...I understand. I'll fly, then!'
'Okay, it's decided.'
'...Yeah.'
Yoru would be the pilot and Asa would be the\nco-pilot.
They were the pilots of the Soaring Club, aiming\nfor the Morning Glory.
'Okay, we'd better get to work repairing the\nglider! When are the materials going to arrive?'
'They're supposed to be coming this afternoon.\nThey'll be coming directly to the secret base.'
'That's so quick!'
'All right! Okay, let's get moving! If\neverything's decided, let's get moving!'
'Good. Let's get to work.'
So, for the second time, we started on the glider\nrepair work.
'Thanks to Asa and Yoru we're going to make\nsomething of ourselves. We've already begun to\nbuild the road, but we aren't there yet.'
'Rather, this is where things are going to get\ntough. Our time limit's very short. But, if we go\nfor it... we can finish in time!'
'Of course. That's why we went and talked with\nGrandpa in the first place.'
'Yeah!'
Since time's running short, we're going to have\nto camp out here at the base.
I asked everybody at the dorm if they could help\nus out by preparing meals for us, and they were\nhappy to cooperate.
'For the time being, I brought some basic food\nand blankets. Potato chips, cup noodles, canned\ngoods, and instant ramen.'
'...Instant ramen...'
'We've also got energy drinks and caffeine!'
The bag that Kanako brought from the super market\nhad a really dubious smell coming from it.
'So, is this gonna be okay, Amane?'
'Hm?'
'Meeting up here at the base.'
'Well, I have work, so I can't stay here all the\ntime. But it's harder to be told not to worry\nabout it.'
'Thank you for everything you've done.'
'I've already been such a bother to everybody.'
'Hey, everyone.'
'I came to help out.'
'Thank you.'
'Huh? Did everyone come?'
'Seems rough. I guess everyone had free time?\nWe'll do whatever we can. Right, Yuka?'
'Sure!'
'Thank you for everything you've done.'
'Huh? We've got quite a crowd today, huh.'
'What's up? Why did so many people come?'
'What's up with you guys?'
'Nothing, it's just that Ageha said that you were\nrestarting club activities, and Akari was like,\n'let's go see what's going on there.''

'Tobioka-sensei's been so annoying about
everything that happened. As usual, right? Even
though the chairman told him to be quiet, he's
still opposing it.'
'Aahahaha...'
I'm sure Tobioka-sensei is super pissed.
'If you fly with inadequate preparation and have\nanother accident, things are gonna get really\nbad, so I figured I should try to help out.'
'Yeah, exactly. Aren't you grateful, Aoi?'
'Yes. I am grateful.'
I was actually really grateful.
It made me realize again that we'd been supported\nby lots of different people.
'I came because I heard Ageha was having a rough\ntime.'
'Hey, I brought some supplies.'
'Whoa. There really are a lot of people here...'
'This is going to be a big family. We might just\nend up finishing before we thought, huh?'
'We're going into overtime. I suppose it never\nhurts to finish ahead of schedule, right?'
'Sure.'
The glider work was progressing feverishly.
We cut the cloth as needed, assembled the frame,\nand stretched the cloth over it.
All of the actual work was possible because of\nthe help we'd gotten from Yoru's family.
We ordered all of the jobs allocated to the\nappropriate stations in a factory owned by Yoru's\nfamily.
And again, we relied on An-chan for plenty of\nhelp with the assembly process.
We managed to get ahold of some special lumber\nthat only Yoru's family could get on such short\nnotice.
It really made it so that the guys could hardly\nlift their heads.
'What should I do with this?'
'Let's see, that's for the tail...'
'Hey everybody. I poured some juice for break\ntime.'
'Kotori. Take the staple gun, please.'
'Oh, okay.'
'Whew, it's hot in here...'
'Yeah, I mean, with so many people in here, what\ndo you expect?'
'Well, in other words, do this like this, here.'
'This goes like this.'
'And when this is like this, it should be alright\nlike this, right?'
'We need to be really careful that the cloth\ndoesn't peel off the wings...'
'Is there anything I can do to help?'
So, the repairs proceeded in a really upbeat\nfashion.
Until now there'd been very few people, so it was\na little overwhelming.
'You really are wonderful.'
'It's not me, it's the Soaring Club, I guess.\nThis is a really good place, so I think that's\nwhy everyone comes here.'
'I see.'
It's not as if they all came here just because of\nme, or for anyone's sake for that matter.
'...It looks just like the culture festival,\ndoesn't it? The day before the culture festival.'
'Do you like the culture festival?'
'Not so much. It's just a bother and it takes too\nmuch time.'
That's what I thought.
'However, I can understand the whole value\nsystem.'
The sun went down, and even though the short hand\nof the clock was trying to pass twelve, we\nweren't finished with club activities yet.
'Well, I guess everything's been laid bare\nhere...'
The goal was in three days.
There were still some parts that we hadn't\nreceived yet, but including all that we could\nstill finish up the repair work in three days.
The only people left were the permanent members\nand Kanako.
'Sigh...'
'You want to go wash your face? You'll feel\nbetter. Or you can put some menthol under your\neyes.'
'...I'm gonna go wash my face.'
'You want to go too, Asa?'
'Could it be...'
Zzzzz.
'She's sleeping standing up with her eyes\nopen...'
'Asa is pretty skilled, huh?'
We just continued like that, day and night,\nworking on the glider repairs.
During the day, some others came to help us out.\nWe were working to ensure that we could prepare\nthe glider for flight again as soon as possible.
Although it was hard, tense work, everyone was\nunusually diligent.
Rather, everyone worked as one, and it was fun\nthe way we were desperately working together to\ncreate something.
We were making a glider. It seems obvious, but we\nhad to reassert that fact.
Then, after three days.
'Finished again!'
We'd completed the glider once again.
'OOOOOOOOHHHH!'
'I can't believe it worked, considering where we\nstarted.'
Before the test flight, the craft was free from\ndamage.
In the end, we all gave it a good polish, so even\nthe original parts shone like new.
'Aoi, we did it!'
Asa said this as she pumped her fist in the air\nwith a gleam in her eye.
'We did it, somehow.'
'All that hard work wasn't for nothing.'
'Wow, a while back we were ready to just give\nup.'
'Let's not even talk about that, okay?'
I really had given up at that time...
'This time I changed you, huh, Aoi?'
'Huh?'
'Oh, nothing at all!'
'So, we really were capable of making the\nglider.'
'Really, we just fixed it.'
'Well, I suppose it's not the kind of job for a\nbunch of students, but the glider we were using\nsince last year has changed a lot.'
'It's been completely transformed... But this\nyear, it was really Yoru...'
'Who's been transformed, who?'
'I'm just amazed...'
'Usually you don't just manufacture a glider.\nIt's all the more impressive because it's so\ndifferent than the usual.'
'Heeya...'
'Well, let's fly it, then...'
Yay!
Everybody was expressing their amazement.
Well, from here on is when the going really gets\ntough.

It seems as if the glider's performance will be
compromised a bit, but for the moment it was
complete. We needed to start considering what we
had to do to reach the Morning Glory.
...First we needed to take it for a test flight\nto see how it fared.

'Including last year, I've always been the one
making preparations for the flights again and
again. It broke, it was destroyed, and we didn't
make it.'
'Was it like that? I don't know. We tried, we\ngave up, we didn't make it... And then we tried\nagain.'
'Yeah, I guess so. You're right.'
'But, since we did it like this, all of us\ntouching it and watching the whole process, it\nfeels a little closer.'
'It was made properly, by hand. Knowing that, it\njust feels more intimate.'
'If you don't know it, then you'll misunderstand\nit. If you know it, then you can somewhat like\nit. It's always going to be like that.'
'...Definitely.'
After that, we raised a toast with the juice that\nKanako had bought.
Despite the fact that we had finally only gotten\nback to square one.
Even though everyone else had already gone back\nhome, Asa, Yoru, and I lingered on.
'Those three days went by in a flash, huh?'
'We were in a panic.'
'I had a great time. I'm sure I'll have good\nmemories of it.'
A huge smile like a sunflower covered Asa's whole\nface.
'It wasn't rough for you? You know, the lack of\nsleep?'
'No, not at all!'
'The only thing was, it was a little hard not\nbeing able to be affectionate with you for so\nlong, since all the others were around.'
'Haha. I'm happy to hear that.'
'You have a point, there. I was like that too the\nentire time, so I feel a bit frustrated.'
When I think about it, I didn't have enough\nchances to flirt with the two either.
Partly because I was busy and everyone else was\naround, but it wasn't just that.
We spent all nighters under a strict schedule to\nredevelop the glider, which was a huge burden to\nmy physical strength.
From the time the work started until today, until\nthe re-completion, we agreed not to use our\nenergy on sex.
So, in other words...
'And so, with that, umm...'
'...Aren't you tired?'
'I'm fine! And besides, isn't there a lot saved\nup, senpai?'
'That's right. You haven't been able to do it for\na long time.'
'It's only been three days, you know.'
'After you do it once, aren't you supposed to do\nit every day?'
'Th-that's...'
'You're already at your peak, right senpai?'
I'm in the middle of puberty, so I can't help it.\nI made that excuse in my heart.
That's right, the glider's completed, so I can\nhave sex.
Although no one said it, all three of us that\nremained here were expecting it.
'Hey, senpai. There's no one else here.'
'Or could it be, you don't want to?'
'No, that's not it.'
On the contrary, because of this conversation, I\nrealized my pants had immediately gotten tight.
I hadn't let any out in a while, so it had built\nup, and my reaction was intense.
'If we're here, we can be as loud as we want.\nWell?'
'Senpai.'
'...I understand.'
I had no reason to turn them down.
